title: Drawing, "Design for Two Andirons and a Sconce of Gilt Bronze for the Pavilion de Bagatelle, Paris", 1777
medium: Pen and ink, brush and watercolor on paper, lined, framed with brown paper stripe and pen and black ink lines
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink, lower margin: Chevets et Bras en Bronze doré. No 5.  Belanger; initials "MA" are inscribed in the medallion on the base under the urn; center of altar, initials "AXV" in the medallion.
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Designs for metal pieces. Upper center, a sconce with a young girl with fire on her head standing among six branches, three on each side, with candles at the tips. Lower left, an andiron with double adorned sphinxes crouching on either side of an urn. Lower right, an andiron with double adorsed griffins crouching on either side of a flame-topped altar.
